p: Cajanol (phytoalexin) is an isoflavone from roots of C. cajan displaying anticancer, antimicrobial, and antiplasmodial activities. Cajanol arrests the cell cycle in the G 2/M phase and induces apoptosis via the ROS-mediated mitochondria-dependent pathway [ 157]. Endophytic strains of Hypocrea lixii from roots of C. cajan have also been reported to produce cajanol in aqueous cultures with anticancer activity [ 137].
